p: Influenza viruses accounted for a large proportion of cases respiratory virus infection, even during the epidemic of 2019-nCoV, in Beijing. No single symptom nor laboratory finding was indicative of a specific respiratory virus; however, the epidemic history was valuable for screening out COVID-19 patients. A combination of epidemic history, symptoms, laboratory findings, chest CT scans, and finally, a pathogenic examination was essential for an accurate diagnosis of respiratory virus infection.
